title: 114_s1398
content:
The Energy Title of America COMPETES Reauthorization Act of 2015 includes provisions for basic research, the Advanced Research Projects Agency-Energy, and the elimination and consolidation of energy programs. The Energy Title of America COMPETES Reauthorization Act of 2015 includes provisions for basic research funding amounts for fiscal years 2016 to 2020 and the Advanced Research Projects Agency-Energy. Section 5012 of the America COMPETES Act is amended to ensure coordination and non-duplication of efforts within ARPA-E, as well as requiring private financing attempts for projects. The America COMPETES Act is amended to protect privileged and confidential information collected by ARPA-E from recipients of financial assistance awards, including commercialization plans and third-party investments. The America COMPETES Act is amended to protect confidential information provided by awardees, including financial investments, revenue from new products, and third-party support sought. The America COMPETES Act is amended to allocate specific funding amounts for fiscal years 2016 to 2020, and make adjustments to paragraph (4)(B) by changing the reference from "(c)(2)(D)" to "(c)(2)(C)". TITLE II--ELIMINATION AND CONSOLIDATION OF PROGRAMS

SEC. 201. ELIMINATION OF PROGRAM AUTHORITIES. The Nuclear Science Talent Expansion Program and the Hydrocarbon Systems Science Talent Expansion Program for Institutions of Higher Education are repealed under the America COMPETES Act. The America COMPETES Act is amended to redesignate subsections and repeal certain sections related to science education and mentoring programs. The America COMPETES Act is amended to repeal authorizations for various science education programs, including Department of Energy Early Career Awards, Distinguished Scientist Program, and PACE Graduate Fellowship Program. Additionally, there is a consolidation of duplicative program authorities. The Energy Policy Act of 2005 is amended to support nuclear science and engineering at universities by awarding grants to increase graduates in nuclear science fields and enhance teaching and research in advanced nuclear technologies. The Energy Policy Act of 2005 is amended to support nuclear science and engineering at universities through grants for advanced nuclear technologies, collaboration with industry and National Laboratories, and bolstering nuclear infrastructure and research facilities. Additionally, the Department of Energy Early Career Awards for Science, Engineering, and Mathematics Researchers Program is consolidated to enhance research and training opportunities for researchers in these fields. The America COMPETES Act allocates $150,000,000 annually for fiscal years 2016 through 2020 for the distinguished scientist program. The Department of Energy Early Career Awards for Science, Engineering, and Mathematics Researchers Program is amended to include an average amount for each year. The America COMPETES Act increases funding for the distinguished scientist program, with amendments to the Department of Energy Early Career Awards program. This includes raising the funding amounts to $190,000 and $490,000, and adjusting the qualifications for assistant professors. The America COMPETES Act increases funding for the distinguished scientist program and amends the Department of Energy Early Career Awards program. Changes include raising funding amounts, adjusting qualifications for assistant professors, and modifying selection processes and criteria. The America COMPETES Act increases funding for science education programs at the Department of Energy, emphasizing coordination across STEM fields and consulting with relevant energy officials. The America COMPETES Act aims to increase participation of women and minorities in STEM education programs at the Department of Energy. The Department serves as the main liaison for coordinating STEM education programs under the President. The Secretary is required to submit a report on the impact of activities funded by the established Fund to the House Committee on Science, Space, and Technology within 180 days. The House of Representatives and Senate committees are involved in amending the America COMPETES Act to enhance the PACE Graduate Fellowship Program. The amendments focus on academic performance and technical understanding, as well as graduate tuition funding. In subsection (e), the title "Director of Science, Engineering, and Mathematics Education" is changed to "Director of the Office of Science."
